head.supplied: Corrowang ¶ Delegate ¶ 3/4/89. ¶ […] ¶ ¶ Re. the supposed Euc. stricta, I have Baron von Mullers new determination, which, though it removes the species to the Parallelanthera, is in my opinion an al...

div.p: MRS 203, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921 Item 1, 89/138, Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney.

Re. the supposed Euc. stricta, I have Baron von Mullers new determination, which, though it removes the species to the Parallelanthera, is in my opinion an almost greater mistake; he says it is Euc. goniocalyx var . and, that in some of its characteristic[s] it approaches E. Gunnii very closely. Evidently there appears to be a good deal of uncertainty in his mind. […]

In looking over the short descriptions of the different species of Eucalypts in the Barons lately published "Key" I have come to the conclusion that the species which he once from the Braidwood district determined for me as Euc. Sieberiana, (local name Cabbage Gum) must be Euc. pauciflora , and also that the species called "Mountain Ash" with a rough bark like "Iron Bark" but the branches smooth must be the true Euc. Sieberiana though once Baron von Muller determined it for me once as Euc. amygdalina var . I had my doubts about that, and send [sent] a complete set of specimens again last spring from Monga, but have up to date not recieved [sic] the determination yet. […]
Not relevant.
